The license plate of Ontario says it all – Ontario, Yours to discover. This is Canada’s most populated state, and it offers cultural richness and serene views with adventures. So, when you are here, make sure you do these things… Sleep Giant in the Thunder Bay: - This natural and remarkable rock peninsula resembles a reclining giant when you view it from the city of Thunder Bay. This park is an outdoor adventure spot and living in tents here for a night will show you the real beauty of this place. Besides that, it is super adventurous too. 
Toronto Island:-Yes, you need to visit the Toronto Island. The dense traffic and fast pace of Canada’s largest city can be avoided at this Island. Have a peaceful time and discover some amazing views while at the Island. 
Wolf howling in the Algonquin Provincial Park: - Discover your primal side and be ready to howl at the moon. A lot of naturalists gather together here for public wolf howls. You will also hear wolves answer back. 
Catch the Raptors game: - If Drake’s on your team then you are certified champions. If you are on Toronto then you should watch a Raptor’s game. This will get your blood pumping due to the excitement and you could spot some celebrities too. 
Theatre fun in Stratford: - Thanks to Justin Bieber for making this small place so famous and familiar. But apart from this, it is known for the theatre performances of Shakespeare works and has also attracted a lot of big stars to attend some marvellous plays. 
Boat tours of the 1000 islands: - Situated on the St. Lawrence River, the 1000 Islands is an ancient region, which was once patrolled by pirates. You can enjoy boat cruises journeys through the routes and enjoy some stunning views too. See ancient castles, turquoise clear water, sandy beaches and so much more. 
Big Apple in Colborne: - This roadside incredible spot is confused with the New York for the similar nickname. But the three-storey high apple houses are a pie making factory, restaurant and an observation deck at the same time. You will get some of the best pies here. Travellers come here for the pie, play mini golf and take a lot of pictures with the giant fruit. So, get some exciting cheap international flights Canada deals and experience tasty pies. 
Skating on Rideau Canal: - If you are a fan of skating, you should go to the Rideau Canal, which has the title of the world’s largest skating rink and is a UNESCO World Heritage Site. The canal is open for 58 skating days during the winter and has a total of around 1, 00,000 visitors every year. You will have the time of your life if you are pro at the sport.
